result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary C. Huston

defendant.name: Huston, Zachary C.

records.addlTxt:
2:31 PM - cases called - 19CF167, 21CF230, 21CF262, 22CF115, 22CF167, 22CF168 and 22CF134.  Defendant Zachary C. Huston in court.  Attorney Kyle R Mayo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mayo .  Statement by the Court - public defender's office is still trying to obtain counsel.  Court will adjourn these matters.  Court notes no victim appeared.  Bond will continue.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:28 PM - cases called - 19CF167, 21CF230, 21CF262, 22CF167, 22CF115 and 22CF168.  Defendant Zachary C. Huston in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin not in court.  Court notes a special prosecutor will need be appointed.  Court will adjourn the adjourned initial appearances but will proceed with the request to lift the no contact in 22CF115.  Court further denies the request to lift the no contact in 22CF115 as the victim does not appear.  Court will further adjourn the bail/bond hearings until Defendant has counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:31 PM - cases called - 19CF167, 21CF230, 22CF115, 21CF262, 22CF167 and 22CF168.  Defendant Zachary C. Huston in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding these matters; victim rights.  Court notes no victims appear.  Court addresses the Defendant - public defender office is still trying to find an attorney.  Court will adjourn the initial appearance in 22CF167 and 22CF168 to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.  Response by Atty Polzin regarding bond motion.  Court directs bond forfeiture proceedings commence in 19CF167, 21CF230, 21CF262, and 22CF115.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding Defendant's motion to reduce bond in 22CF167.  Statement by Defendant regarding bond in 22CF167.  Court questions Defendant.  Responses by Defendant.  Court questions Atty Polzin.  Response by Atty Polzin.  Statement by the Court.  Court denies bond reduction in 22CF167.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:47 PM - cases called - 22CF167 and 22CF168.  Defendant Zachary C. Huston appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared via Zoom, specially.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Fehrenbach - in receipt of complaint - waive reading - he does qualify for a public defender.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Atty Fehrenbach.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
